data.title: Dani Olmo
data.meta_description:
He had a 60m€ release clause expiring a month ago, and now Barca come in with 4 weeks less left in the window to reportedly offer 59m € to Leipzig.
These...
data.text:
Aug 1, 2024

#121

Acrobat7

Full Member

Joined

May 13, 2013

Messages

6,041

Location

La Axarquía

Supports

Bayern Munich

He had a 60m€ release clause expiring a month ago, and now Barca come in with 4 weeks less left in the window to reportedly offer 59m € to Leipzig.

These guys can't help themselves but be dumb arseholes, can they

I am very certain it has something to do with the business year ending June 30.

Aug 1, 2024

#122

dinostar77

Full Member

Feb 6, 2014

8,328

Great. This means Barca can’t afford Nico Williams.

He's already given reassurances to Barcelona that they can have his signature next summer and that he isn't leaving bilabo this summer. That's why Barcelona moved for Olmo now. They can sort finances out for next summer to pay for nico.

He's already given reassurances to Barcelona that they can have his signature next summer and that he isn't leaving bilabo this summer. That's why Barcelona moved for Olmo now. They can sort finances out for next summer to pay for nico.

Why great? You want Arsenal to get Nico Williams?

No, so WE can buy him.

He will be available for the same price next summer. They will buy him then.

Unless he only wants Barca, which might be the case since nobody is going for him this window so far. If not, they won’t get a free run at home, especially being skint as they are.

So we can buy him hehe

Ah I see. Not too convinced by those to be honest, always thought Osimhen is a fair bit less involved than Lewa is. And I always had Gündogan in my mind with a fairly rounded skillset, is Olmo comparable - always had him as an attacker who doesn't offer a lot against the ball.

Osimhen was a random suggestion as Barcelona will probably have to buy a marquee centre forward to replace leo eventually. Pini Zahavi his agent and also the agent of Hans flick doesn't have any other marquee Centre Forwards on his books.

Leo is supremely fit for his age, like CR7 and zlatan they really take care of their bodies. Wouldn't surprise me if Zahavi tried to keep Leo at Barcelona for as long as possible until he can sign a marquee CF to his agency and recommend that CF to Barcelona.

Finally returning to Barca at a time when Real are a juggernaut and he will continue to win nothing. Seems like another bad move for someone so gifted.

Didn't Barca win the league in 2022/23? Hell, even in Real's Champions League pomp of the 10's, Barca were winning more La Ligas than Real. If there's one thing history tells you, it's that Real being a juggernaut in Europe doesn't always correlate with them winning La Liga.

There's always every chance that Barca could win the league.
